titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Collection of Awards Ephemera PASC.0209
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Norma M. Vega; machine-readable finding aid created by Norma M. Vega and Julie Graham.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-08 13:30:02 -0800.

did.abstract: Awards have honored organizations and individuals in the motion picture and television industry for decades. The collection consists of programs and a small number of printed ephemera items from motion picture and television related award presentation ceremonies, including the Academy Awards, Emmy Awards, American Film Institute Awards, and Golden Globes Awards.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collection of Awards Ephemera (Collection PASC 209). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of ceremony programs and a small number of printed ephemera items from motion picture and television related award presentation ceremonies. The bulk of the material is from the Academy Awards, Emmy Awards, American Film Institute Awards, and Golden Globes Award presentation ceremonies.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Series 1: Academy Awards (Boxes 1-6)
Series 2: American Cinema Awards (Box 10)
Series 3: American Film Institute Life Achievement Awards (Boxes 9-10)
Series 4: Directors Guild Of America Awards (Box 10)
Series 5: Emmy Awards (Boxes 6-8, 11)
Series 6: Emmy Awards (Daytime programming)(Boxes 6)
Series 7: Golden Boot Awards (Box 10)
Series 8: Golden Globe Awards (Boxes 8-9)
Series 9: Television Academy Hall of Fame Awards (Box 10)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the series consists of ceremony programs from the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences, Academy Awards ceremonies. Additionally, there are occasional ballot rules, Governors Ball programs, invitations, luncheon programs and reminder lists related to the award events. The series is arranged chronologically.
